channel.title: R on Maddie's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in R on Maddie's Blog

item.title: Time Series
item.description: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) This next data vizualization is a time series. For this we are extracting data about Babe Ruth’s Homerun totals throughout his career. query<-"select yearID,HR from Batting where playerID='ruthba01'" result<-sqldf(query) For this graph we are actually putting two graphs on top of each other: a line graph and a scatterplot. It makes it easier to make sense of the representation of this data.

item.title: Histograms
item.description: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) It’s time to build a histogram on Rstudio! After we download the Lahman, sqldf, and ggplt2 packages, we are going to select a certain column from the Master list to display. Let’s do body weight for all the players. query<-"select weight from Master" result<-sqldf(query) Now we just translate this data into a histogram using this code.

item.title: Scatterplot building
item.description: Scatterplots are a form of data vizualization. To start building one on Rstudio we have to download these three packages: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) So we want to find career strikeouts and career homeruns for all players who have hit 400 or more homeruns total. We are using the command AS to change the column title in the console.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
